attributes.action: review those entitled to a reduced toll charge at the Dartford Crossing / M25
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: recent local coverage shows that those living in Gravesham area would not be entitled to a reduced toll charge for using the Dartford/QE2 crossing on the M25 motorway. This crossing is the first opportunity to cross the river Thames and for it to increase to £1.50 each way is too high. The catchment area for reduced toll fees should be extended to a 15 mile radius on both sides of the crossing or ideally it should be made free-of-charge. The slight reduction for TAG users is not significant but serves for those that use them as a convenient method of payment. To reduce congestion scrap the toll alltogether
